display.title: Energy Transfer
description: Cable networks have limitations on the amount of energy they will pull into the network depending on tier.
256 EU/t for LV cables, 1024 EU/t for MV cables and 8192 EU/t for HV cables.
Because there is no output limit for the network and because cables have a small internal storage, an LV network can provide more than 256 EU/t for a short amount of time.
Note however that single block electric machines will only connect to LV cables!
To transfer more energy, you need to either create multiple pipe networks or use Transformers.
As you would expect, an X to Y Transformer will connect to Y cables on its output side and to X cables on its 5 other sides.

subtitle.text: Cable networks have limitations on the amount of energy they will pull into the network depending on tier.
